summary: Vague report of images not appearing on screen — no code, no repro, no details provided

type.reason: Title uses [BUG] prefix and type/bug label is applied, but the body contains no evidence of a bug — just a single vague sentence with no code, no error, no expected/actual behavior. Could equally be a usage question.

area.reason: No specific API, class, or component mentioned. 'Images not appearing' could involve core SkiaSharp, Views, or even a MAUI/platform rendering issue. Defaulting to SkiaSharp as the broadest applicable area.

platforms.reason: Reporter selected 'macOS' in the platform field, though IDE is listed as 'Visual Studio (Windows)' which is contradictory — may be running VS for Mac or cross-compiling.

regression.reason: Reporter listed 'Last Known Good Version' as 2.88.9, implying it worked before. However, no details confirm this — the field may have been filled mechanically from the template defaults.

bugSignals.severityReason: No crash, no data loss, no stack trace. Description is too vague to assess actual impact. 'Images not appearing' could range from a rendering bug to a simple API misuse.

repoLinks.description: Placeholder repo link from the issue template — not an actual reproduction project.

reproEvidence.environmentDetails: SkiaSharp 3.116.0, Visual Studio (Windows), macOS. No OS version, no device info, no .NET version specified.

versionAnalysis.reason: Version 3.116.0 is the current release. Last known good is 2.88.9 which is the previous major era. Without details on what changed or what API is involved, relevance cannot be determined.

actionability.reason: The issue contains essentially no actionable information — no code, no expected/actual behavior, no screenshots, no error messages. Cannot investigate without basic details.

suggestedResponse.reason: Almost every required detail is missing. Need code, expected behavior, actual behavior, and ideally a minimal repro project before any investigation is possible.
suggestedResponse.draft:
Thanks for filing this. To look into the images not appearing, we'd need a bit more detail:

- A minimal code snippet or sample project showing how you're loading and displaying images
- What you expect to see vs. what actually happens (blank canvas? exception? partial rendering?)
- Any error output or warnings in the console/log

The version info is helpful — if this worked in 2.88.9 but not 3.116.0, a small repro project would let us narrow down the regression quickly. Would you be able to share one?

analysisNotes.summary: This is an extremely low-information bug report. The body contains one vague sentence ('I have some code that puts things on the screen, but nothing appears'), template placeholder code blocks, and no expected or actual behavior. Filed by mattleibow (a project contributor). The issue cannot be investigated in its current state.

keySignals.text: I have some code that puts things on the screen, but nothing appears.
keySignals.interpretation: The only substantive sentence in the issue. Too vague to determine if this is a rendering bug, API misuse, or platform issue. No specific API or behavior mentioned.
Template placeholder — no actual code was provided. The code section is completely empty of real content.

keySignals.text: Expected Behavior: _No response_; Actual Behavior: _No response_
keySignals.interpretation: Reporter did not fill in expected or actual behavior sections, making it impossible to understand what's broken.
Suggests a regression from 2.x to 3.x, but without details this could be a template default selection rather than confirmed regression testing.
Contradictory — Visual Studio for Windows but targeting macOS. Could mean VS for Mac, remote debugging, or cross-compilation. Adds uncertainty to platform classification.

fieldRationales.expandedReason: The [BUG] title prefix and type/bug label indicate the reporter intended this as a bug. However, with no error, no crash, and no actual behavior described, this could equally be a usage question. Confidence is low (0.55).

alternatives.whyRejected: Reporter explicitly chose the bug template and the title says [BUG]. Deferring to their classification despite insufficient evidence.

fieldRationales.expandedReason: No specific component, class, or API is mentioned. 'Images not appearing' is too generic to narrow down. Using SkiaSharp as the broadest default.

alternatives.whyRejected: 'Appearing on screen' could imply a view component, but this is speculative without any code.
No mention of MAUI, Xamarin, or any UI framework.

fieldRationales.expandedReason: Reporter selected macOS in the platform field. The contradiction with 'Visual Studio (Windows)' IDE lowers confidence but the explicit platform selection is the best signal available.
No crash, no data loss, no stack trace. The vague description of 'images not appearing' could range from cosmetic to critical, but without evidence, defaulting to low.

alternatives.whyRejected: No evidence of functional breakage beyond the vague claim. Cannot justify medium without more detail.

fieldRationales.expandedReason: The issue is missing nearly every required detail: no code, no expected behavior, no actual behavior, no error messages, no screenshots. Investigation is impossible without more information.

alternatives.whyRejected: Nothing to investigate — there's no code, no error, and no specific behavior described.
Reporter chose the bug template, so giving them a chance to provide details before converting.

docsConsulted.relevance: Referenced for field definitions, allowed enum values, and cross-field validation rules.
Calibrated output format and severity/confidence levels against example issues.
Checked bug research checklist. Most research steps are inapplicable due to lack of information in the issue.

analysisNotes.docsNotConsulted: Did not consult documentation/packages.md, references/skia-patterns.md, or API docs because the issue provides no specific technical details (no API names, no error messages, no platform-specific symptoms) that would make those references relevant.
uncertainties: Whether this is a real bug report or a test/template issue filed by the maintainer
What 'images not appearing' actually means — blank canvas, missing file, rendering error, or display issue
Whether the IDE/platform contradiction (VS Windows + macOS) indicates cross-compilation or a form-filling error
Whether the 2.88.9 last-known-good version is a confirmed regression or a template default
assumptions: Assumed the reporter intends this as a genuine bug report despite the lack of detail, because the type/bug label was applied
Assumed macOS is the target platform despite the VS Windows IDE selection, because the platform field was explicitly chosen

resolutionAnalysis.hypothesis: The reporter is experiencing images not rendering in a SkiaSharp application on macOS, possibly a regression from 2.88.9 to 3.116.0. Without code or details, the root cause could be anything from incorrect API usage to a genuine rendering regression.
researchDone: Reviewed issue body — found no actionable technical details
Checked for code snippets — only template placeholders present
Noted version gap from 2.88.9 to 3.116.0 — major version jump with many breaking changes
Checked for similar open issues — cannot narrow search without specific symptoms

proposals.title: Request minimal reproduction project
proposals.description: Ask the reporter to provide a minimal project or code snippet that demonstrates the issue, along with expected vs actual behavior.
steps: Comment requesting a minimal repro project with specific code that fails
Ask for expected vs actual behavior description
Ask for any console output or error messages
Wait for response before investigating further
pros: Gets the essential information needed for any investigation
Respects reporter's time by asking once

proposals.title: Check 2.x to 3.x migration breaking changes
proposals.description: If this is a regression from 2.88.9 to 3.116.0, review the migration guide and breaking changes between these versions for image-related APIs.
steps: Review SkiaSharp 3.x migration guide for image API changes
Check if SKBitmap/SKImage APIs changed between versions
Identify common migration pitfalls for image loading/rendering
Share relevant migration notes with reporter
pros: Addresses the most likely cause if this is a real regression
Proactive — helps even before full repro
cons: Speculative without knowing which APIs are involved
May not apply if it's a usage error

proposals.title: Close as incomplete after timeout
proposals.description: If no response after a reasonable period (e.g., 30 days), close the issue as incomplete with a note that it can be reopened with more details.
steps: If no response, close with 'incomplete' label
Note that issue can be reopened with reproduction details
cons: May lose a valid bug report if reporter is busy

resolutionAnalysis.recommendedReason: The single most effective action is getting actual code and behavior details. Everything else is speculative without this information.
